title: Scott Willsey
description: Long time Twitter and all around pal. Good guy with an affinity for tech and the open web.

title: Ed Zitron's Where's Your Ed At
description: A microblogger I followed at micro.blog and whose thoughts I am interested in and enjoy reading about.

title: Beard Guy Musings
description: I find this guy's blog comforting yet inspiring. His move for social justice and activism keeps me reading.

title: Mark Pitblado
description: His self-hosting posts and developer posts are great but he's also a thoughtful blogger as well.

title: Joe Ross
description: Excellent follow on Mastodon and his writing is some of the more interesting in the indie tech space.

title: Jason Burke
description: Another micro.blog follow. His blog is also just a fantastic place; the landing page is just super fun.

title: Brilliantcrank
description: An old cranky techy who writes about politics, tech, and humanitarianism.

title: LewisDale.dev
description: His willingness to be publicly vulnerable makes this a beginning of the day and end of night read.

title: LJPUK â€“ Sharing my passions
description: A perspective of American tech from across the pond. It's thoughtful, some posts are brief, like a personal website can be, but always worth a read.

title: Aaron Godfrey
description: An excellent resource for home automation outside of homelab setups.

title: Chris McLeod
description: Chris is an incredible developer and his website gives me a ton of inspiration.

title: Andrew Healey
description: Andrew is who I wanted to be when I was trying to get further in the industry. Unlimited curiosity and an abundance of intelligence and the ability to build things without thinking about the end goal.
